claim: As per ICMR study there’s been not a single case of COVID-19 among indigenous Assamese communities in India.
label: FALSE

claim: The Philippines has fewer COVID-19 cases despite having a larger population and smaller land area than Italy. The post attributed it to Pres. Rodrigo Duterte’s “immediate response” to the pandemic.
label: MISLEADING

claim: Brazilian new Minister of Health, Nelson Teich, is investigating COVID-19 statistics for alleged fraud. Because of that, the number of cases and deaths have been falling in Brazil on the week of April 24.
label: False

claim: The case fatality rate of COVID-19 is actually 28-55 times lower.
label: FALSE

claim: The US hospitals inflate the number of COVID-19 cases and deaths so they can receive more money.
label: No evidence

claim: COVID-19 is going away. On April 21, the number of new cured cases was larger than the number of new cases, which means the total number of active cases is diminishing.
label: FALSE

claim: An audio file by an alleged worker at a health institution in Rio de Janeiro. She says that healthcare workers on public institutions in Rio are forced to state whether a patient has COVID-19 or not even before he sees a doctor. This was, allegedly, being done to artificially inflate the number of cases.
label: FALSE

claim: The April 22 jump in COVID-19 cases in the United States was related to the election.
label: FALSE

claim: 567 positive cases and 39 deaths from COVID-19 were recorded in Mali on April 13, 2020.
label: FALSE

claim: Colombia is the country with less cases and deaths for coronavirus per inhabitant in America.
label: False

claim: Screenshot shows 109 coronavirus cases in a Cali’s neighborhood in Colombia.
label: FALSE

claim: “Nearly half of (Missouri) counties have not reported positive (COVID-19) cases.”
label: FALSE

claim: The danger of coronavirus is exaggerated. Look at the case of Mumbai slums.
label: FALSE

claim: People are offering prayers in groups on rooftops despite lockdown. That too when cases of coronavirus in India are continuously increasing.
label: FALSE

claim: Claim that according to the New York Times, US ballistic-missile submarine USS Tennessee has eight confirmed cases. Since the submarine was on a mission for 119 days, it indicated that the virus was originated from the US.
label: FALSE
